intro: Rondeletia gonzaleoides, commonly known as the golden rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture, making it a visually appealing ornamental plant.
